newsitem.title: USA: Apparent mass suicide in mansion outside San Diego.
newsitem.headline: Apparent mass suicide in mansion outside San Diego.

text.p: Deputies found at least 10 bodies at the scene of an apparent mass suicide in a luxury mansion, the San Diego Sheriff's Department said on Wednesday.
Sgt. Don Crist told Reuters the department received a call in the afternoon about bodies at a house in the exclusive community of Rancho Santa Fe, some 20 miles (32 km) north of San Diego.
Deputies who went to the house found at least 10 bodies, Crist said. "They lost count at 10," he said. Homicide detectives were investigating.
Unconfirmed media reports put the number of dead higher.
Local TV station, KFMB, quoted a reporter at the scene as saying the bodies were in a "multimillion-dollar house" in Rancho Santa Fe.
The house, with a tennis court and swimming pool, and surrounded by horse ranches, had been rented by a group of people since October 1996, the reporter said, quoting neighbours.
The incident came after a cult suicide in Saint Casimir, Quebec last weekend.
Five members of a notorious doomsday cult died in a blazing house Saturday in an apparent ritual suicide pact, but spared three teenage children, Quebec police said.
